m_q.target_metric: Sentiment classification predictions for tweets in test dataset
sub_questions: What are the sentiment classes present in the training data?
What features from the tweets should be used for classification (OriginalTweet text)?
Should UserName, ScreenName, Location, and TweetAt be used as features?
What is the distribution of sentiment classes in the training data?
How should text preprocessing be handled (URLs, mentions, hashtags, special characters)?
What classification model should be trained on Corona_NLP_train.csv?
How should predictions be formatted in sentiment.csv?

schema_conflicts: Corona_NLP_test.csv lacks the Sentiment column which is the target variable present in Corona_NLP_train.csv

unit_annotations.OriginalTweet: raw tweet text with URLs, hashtags, mentions

cross_source_conflicts: UserName and ScreenName ranges may differ between train and test sets
Date ranges differ: training data shows 16-03-2020 dates, test data shows 02-03-2020 to 05-03-2020 dates

format_notes: OriginalTweet contains commas, quotes, URLs, hashtags, mentions, and special characters requiring proper CSV parsing
Location field contains many empty values
Training data has 6 columns including Sentiment, test data has 5 columns without Sentiment
Some OriginalTweet values may be empty or contain only whitespace
Tweet text contains embedded newlines, ampersand entities (&), and emoji

constraints: Output file must be named sentiment.csv
Number of predictions must match number of rows in Corona_NLP_test.csv (3798 rows)
Sentiment predictions must use same class labels as in training data
Model must be trained on Corona_NLP_train.csv
Predictions must be made for Corona_NLP_test.csv
output_format_requirements: Sentiment values must match training data categories
Should maintain order corresponding to Corona_NLP_test.csv rows
